instruction: Who are some eminent scholars of the Quechua language?
output:
Brother of the 20th century was a Quechua-speaking Americanist scholar and missionary, who devoted his life to the translation of the Bible into the languages of South America.
Rene de la Pedraja (1843–1917) was a Quechua-speaking Spanish historian, linguist and ethnographer. He traveled extensively in the Andean regions and examined Quechua folklore, religion, and language.
Max Uhle (1856–1941) was a German-born, naturalized Peruvian anthropologist and linguist. He is famous for his studies on the Quechua languages and for the Uhle–Kanakla Texts, a collection of Quechua oral literature.
John Alden Mason (1900-1994) was an eminent student of Andean languages, especially Quechua. He authored several grammars, including "Studies in Quechua Grammar" (1942).

instruction: What medicine should I take when I get a cold?
output:
It's that time of year again. The weather is getting colder, the days are getting shorter, and everyone around you seems to be getting sick. You want to do everything you can to avoid catching a cold, but what should you do when you do get one?
There is no cure for the common cold. Antibiotics won't help because they only treat infections caused by bacteria, not viruses like the common cold. In fact, antibiotics will do more harm than good if taken when a virus is causing symptoms because they kill healthy bacteria in your body along with the disease-causing bacteria.
The best thing to do when you get a cold is to take care of yourself and let the illness run its course. While you can't completely stop a cold, there are over-the-counter medications that can relieve some of your symptoms so you feel better while your body fights off the virus.
These medicines may make you feel better, but they won't cure your cold. It's important to understand that while you may be able to reduce your symptoms with these medications, it can take up to two weeks for your body to fight off the virus and for your symptoms to completely go away.
Decongestants help relieve congestion in your nose. They come in pill form or as a nasal spray. Decongestant pills work on the blood vessels in your nose which helps decrease swelling and makes it easier to breathe through your nose. Nasal sprays work quickly and are a good choice if your congestion is severe. Just be careful not to use them for more than three days or you could end up with rebound congestion where the blood vessels in your nose become even more swollen when you stop using the spray.

instruction: What should I buy my son for his seventh birthday?
output:
yesterday i took my son to a local thrift store. he was very excited because he has been saving up his allowance for a while so he could buy himself something special when we went there. after looking around and seeing that the selection of toys was pretty sad, i asked him if he wanted me to buy him something. he graciously said no.
i was shocked at first but then i thought 'wow, what a great life lesson. not everything in life is going to be awesome, but if you work hard and save up, you can buy yourself something nice when you really need or want it.'
so instead of buying him something, i suggested we go to target and get him a small giftcard to spend on himself. he loved this idea.

instruction: In a world where automation is becoming increasingly prevalent, is it more important to prioritize job creation or technological progress?

He also suggests that we need to rethink our approach to work and redesign jobs so that they are more meaningful and fulfilling for people.
On the other hand, some argue that technological progress is essential to improving our standard of living and that automation can lead to increased productivity and job creation. They point out that automation has freed people from mundane and dangerous tasks, allowing them to pursue more creative and fulfilling work. However, others argue that automation has also led to job losses and that we need to ensure that the benefits of technological progress are shared more fairly.
Ultimately, prioritizing either job creation or technological progress depends on your values and beliefs about the role of technology in society. It is important to consider both the potential benefits and drawbacks of automation and to work towards a future that prioritizes human flourishing and social justice.

instruction: Suppose that Alan Turing and the folks at Bletchly Park were not able to break the Enigma ciphers. How would this have affected the Second World War?
output:
The Enigma machine was a device used by the Germans in World War II to encrypt their communications. The device was made up of a number of rotating discs with letters inscribed on them. Each disc represented a different letter of the alphabet. The user would select the first and last letters of the message, then rotate the discs to create a random-looking sequence of letters. This sequence would then be enciphered using a plugboard and a series of mathematical tables to produce the final encrypted message.
Alan Turing and his team at Bletchley Park were able to break the Enigma ciphers by building a bombe machine that could try all possible combinations of settings for the Enigma machine. They also discovered the daily keys used by the Germans, which allowed them to read many of the messages sent by the German High Command.

instruction: Write an essay discussing the importance of communication in a relationship.
output:
Relationships are built on communication. Effective communication is essential for any relationship to be successful. It helps couples understand each other better, work through conflicts, and make decisions together. Without good communication, relationships can become strained and even break down.
Effective communication involves more than just talking. It includes active listening, meaningful conversation, and open dialogue. It also requires that both partners listen to each other and respect each other's opinions. When two people can communicate effectively, they can build a strong emotional connection and develop trust in one another. This trust is essential for a lasting relationship.
Communication also plays a key role in problem-solving. When couples can communicate openly and honestly, they can work together to find solutions to any problems that arise. This can help them weather difficult times and stay committed to each other, even in the face of adversity.
Overall, effective communication is vital for any relationship. It helps couples grow closer, work through challenges, and build a strong foundation of trust and respect. By communicating openly and honestly, partners can create a loving and supportive relationship that lasts a lifetime.

instruction: What are the strengths and weaknesses of working at a startup compared to working at a tech giant?
output:
Having worked at both, I can tell you that there are some clear differences.
Working at a startup is exciting and fast-paced, but it can also be quite stressful. You'll likely have a lot of responsibility early on, which can be both good and bad. On the plus side, you'll be able to make a big impact on the company's direction and success. On the downside, if things don't work out, it's likely that you'll be let go sooner rather than later.
Working at a tech giant is more stable, but it's also less likely that you'll be able to make a huge impact on the company's direction. You'll likely have fewer responsibilities, which can be both good and bad. On the plus side, you'll likely have more resources and support. On the downside, it can be difficult to stand out and get noticed when there are so many other people around you.

instruction: I'm 30F, one of the only women out of 50 employees (tech startup). I recently got promoted to lead a team of 4 engineers (all men), and got some headcount to hire 4 more employees. Out of 12 candidates (6 men and 6 women), most of the best ones are men. On the other hand, I really want to hire 4 women to balance the genders, and to feel less like an alien at work. How do I convince my superior (the CTO) that I have to hire 4 women?
output:
The worst possible answer is to try to convince your superiors that you need to hire women because you feel uncomfortable being the only woman in the team. That's gender discrimination, and will get you into a lot of trouble if it's found out.
As for the other answers, they assume that some candidates are more skilled than others. However, this can be because those candidates have had more opportunities to practice their skills. When I was involved in recruiting for a startup, we realized that we were getting applications from way too many software engineering students, and not enough application from other fields. To counteract this, we started actively recruiting people with a background in physics, math or computer science, even if they didn't have as much experience as software engineers.
Now, unless you have good reasons to believe that the best candidates are female (and not male), then you should assume that all candidates are equally skilled. That means that there's no reason to prefer one gender over the other.
Unfortunately, since you are the only woman in the team, you do stick out. You need to accept that, and learn to deal with it. This might mean asking your fellow engineers to introduce you to new people and help you get to know everyone better.
It also means that you shouldn't expect your coworkers to understand completely what it's like to be a woman in a team full of men. Of course, they should try to be nice and helpful, but they probably won't be able to relate to how you feel on a day-to-day basis.
If you can, try to find some female colleagues who can help you through this difficult time. If not, look for external sources of support, like Meetup groups or online communities.

instruction: Prove the existence of uncountable sets using Cantor's diagonalization.
output: A set is uncountable if it is not denumerable. A set is denumerable if it can be put into one-to-one correspondence with the integers. For example, the set of natural numbers is denumerable, but the set of real numbers is not.

instruction: Write a short story based on the following prompt:  “Ninja visibility peaked in the 1980’s, and as you can see it’s been on a steady decline since. The consensus of most ninjologists is that they’re extinct, but I disagree. I think they’ve perfected their technique. And I think I can prove it.”
output:
Most people believe that the art of ninjutsu has been forgotten. That it is no longer practiced and exists only in stories and legends. But I believe differently. I believe that the ninjas are still out there, hidden in plain sight. And I have the proof to back up my claim.
In the 1980s, ninja visibility peaked. They were everywhere. In movies, on television, in video games. They were even featured in popular toys and action figures. But as time went by, their presence faded. People stopped noticing them. They disappeared from public view.
But I think I know why. I think they’ve perfected their technique. They’ve learned how to blend in with their surroundings so well that they are practically invisible. They are masters of camouflage, able to disappear entirely from sight.
I’ve done extensive research on the matter. I’ve studied every available document, interviewed experts in the field, and even consulted with some of the world’s leading ninjologists. And I’ve come to the conclusion that the ninjas are still among us, living and breathing in our modern world. We just can’t see them.
So I challenge you, reader, to help me find these elusive beings. To prove to the world that they exist. Let’s work together to uncover the secrets of the ninja and expose their true nature to the world.

USDA Prime is the least common grade. Choice is the most common, followed by Select, then Standard.
I'm not sure about other cultures, but in the U.S., the grading system for beef is based on the amount and distribution of marbling (aka "fat") in the meat. The higher the grade, the more marbling. This is because marbling is considered to be good for flavor and tenderness. However, more marbling also makes the meat more expensive. USDA Prime is the highest grade, with the most marbling, which is why it's also the most expensive.

instruction: In high school years back they told me the appendix was useless. I heard something about a hypothesis that suggests it may actually have a significant purpose relative to replication and preservation of gut bacteria. What's that about? What do we know about how gut bacteria works?
output:
There's evidence that the immune system is influenced by gut bacteria. What may prove to be more important is the fact that we carry a huge number of bacteria in our gastrointestinal tract, and some of these have been implicated in diseases such as ulcerative colitis and Crohn's disease.
The hypothesis about the appendix being for bacteria was proposed by one surgeon in 1879 (I think), but it didn't catch on until the late 20th century when advances in microbiology allowed more investigation of the bacteria in our gut. It's still controversial, though, since there are many other organs that can host large numbers of bacteria, but no one seriously argues they're "vestigial".
Evolution isn't perfect - it doesn't create organisms which are optimized at every level. There are lots of "junk" DNA and old structures which seem to have lost their original function. The human genome is rife with examples of this sort of thing, and the appendix is just one of hundreds (if not thousands) of examples.

instruction: How should I do time manage spreading time working on multiple projects? For example, should I "time block" your calendar and say 8am to 10am I work Project A. And 10am to 11am I work on Project B. What are other methods besides time blocking?
output:
Time blocking is the most common way to manage your time. It's a method of scheduling your day by blocking off specific time slots for specific activities. For example, you might block off two hours every morning to work on Project A and then two hours in the afternoon to work on Project B.
Another method is called "batching" or "time batching". This involves grouping similar tasks together so that you can complete multiple similar tasks at once. For example, you might batch your email responses or phone calls so that you answer all of them at once rather than checking your email/phone every few minutes throughout the day.
You can also try the Pomodoro technique, which involves setting a timer for 25 minutes and focusing on a single task without distractions. After 25 minutes, take a short break (3-5 minutes) before starting another round of focused work. You can repeat this process several times until you reach the end of your workday.
